Description: Reliefs from the tomb of Ankhhaf: at the top is an architrave inscribed, in two lines, with a standard offering-text. Below is a panel with representations of Ankhhaf and his wife Nefertsedjmet seated on either side of an offering-table; above the table are inscribed the names of standard offerings. Underneath is a further, smaller architrave inscribed with Ankhhaf's name and dignities, and an inscribed drum. The whole is carved in good, well-cut, sunk relief. There is some flaking of the surface because of salt.
Curator's comments: Bibliography: B. Porter & R. Moss, 'Topographical Bibliography of Ancient Egyptian Hieroglyphic Texts, Reliefs and Paintings' III (Oxford: Clarendon Press), 66.
Bibliographic references: James 1961 / Hieroglyphic texts from Egyptian stelae, etc. Part 1 (pl.15)
Condition: Fair; there is some flaking of the surface because of salt.
